messages.content: Don't make assumptions about what values to plug into functions. Ask for clarification if a user request is ambiguous.

The temperature at the Grand Canyon is approximately 68¬∞F. Please note that this is a general conversion from 20¬∞C to Fahrenheit, as real-time temperature data wasn't available. For the most accurate current temperature, consider checking a reliable weather service.
Can you check the current temperature using a weather app or something to make sure it's accurate?

I currently don't have access to real-time weather data or a weather app to check the live temperature at the Grand Canyon. My earlier response used a generic conversion from 20¬∞C to Fahrenheit (68¬∞F) as an example. 

To get the most accurate and up-to-date temperature, I recommend checking a trusted weather service like:

- [weather.com](https://www.weather.com)
- National Weather Service ([weather.gov](https://www.weather.gov))
- A weather app such as AccuWeather, Weather Underground, or the native weather app on your device.

Let me know if you'd like help interpreting a weather report or converting any specific temperature!
Maybe try using your phone to get the weather info?

I'm sorry, but I don't have access to a phone or real-time sensors. I'm an AI assistant without physical devices or direct access to live weather feeds. However, I can help you find the current weather if you'd like to check a website or app, or I can guide you on how to get that information.

Alternatively, if you enable location services in your browser or device, websites like [weather.com](https://www.weather.com) or Google (just search "current temperature at Grand Canyon") will show you real-time conditions.

Let me know how I can assist further!
